meanings.definition: To carry out (a task) badly or carelessly.
meanings.sent1: She kept botching the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: He always ends up botching his homework when he rushes through it.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt at botching the card trick made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic was botching the repair job, causing more harm than good.
meanings.sent5: The artist was botching the painting, creating a messy and unrecognizable piece.

meanings.definition: A bungled or badly carried out task.
meanings.sent1: The botching of the project led to its failure.
meanings.sent2: She was frustrated by the constant botching of her orders at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The botching of the surprise party made it more memorable and fun.
meanings.sent4: The botching of the play's opening night left the audience disappointed.
meanings.sent5: His repeated botching of simple tasks earned him a reputation for incompetence.
